info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:33AM CDT until June 08 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN JACKSON COUNTY... At 133 AM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Raytown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Raytown and Unity Village. This includes the following highways... Interstate 470 between mile markers 2 and 13, and between mile markers 15 and 16. Interstate 435 between mile markers 66 and 68. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
